creator: redha@clientsoft.com
text:
Using Ant 1.5beta2 and Jax obfuscator.

When I tried to pass new environmenent variable to jax to be able to use the 
JDK 1.1, the log shows that is still using the JDK 1.3.1_03(env for ant).

build task:
----------
      <java classname="com.ibm.jax.Batch" 
			fork="true" 
			dir="${basedir}/${crypteScript}" 
			failonerror="true"
			newenvironment="true">
			<env key="JAVA_HOME" path="${JDK1_1}"/>
			<env key="PATH" path="${JDK1_1}/bin"/>
			<env key="CLASSPATH" 
path="${JDK1_1}/lib/classes.zip;${crypteTool}"/>
			<sysproperty key="HOME" path="${basedir}/
${crypteScript}" /> 
			<arg value="${script}.jax"/>
			<classpath>
			   <pathelement location="${JDK1_1}/lib/classes.zip" /> 
			   <pathelement location="${crypteTool}" />
			</classpath>
	   </java>

log :
---
     [java] jax V6.1-Monday-Oct-18-1999 Copyright IBM 1997-1999. All rights 
reserved.

     [java] More info: http://www.alphaWorks.ibm.com/tech/jax
     [java]            http://www.research.ibm.com/jax


     [java] Configuration file name is "script.jax"
     [java] JDK used is Sun Microsystems Inc. version 1.3.1_03

Did I miss something? As Jax doesn't work with jdk greater than 1.1 I really 
need to able to run jax with the jdk 1.1.

Thanks.

Redha

creator: holtdl@yahoo.com
text:
Rather than trying to do it through env vars, have you tried just specifying 
the 'jvm' attribute?

Thanks Diane.

Yes using jvm attribute set as jvm="${JDK1_1}/bin/java" works.

Does it means that you can not change the jdk version through the "env" 
element?
creator: redha@clientsoft.com

text:
Maybe if you were running Ant's class, since JAVA_HOME is only meaningful to 
Ant (never tried it, though, so I can't say for sure).

If you're satisfied that this bug report can be closed out, please feel free to 
do so.
creator: holtdl@yahoo.com

text:
The value of JAVA_HOME doesn't affect which JDK you get.  Ant will use the same
JDK it is running in (at least it will try) unless you specify the jvm
attribute.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
